page.title: 07ST. KEW CHURCH.
page.content: The population attending the church has gone down and then up since the war,and now there are more ladies than men that come.There are 6 bells in our church and the tenor bell is the biggest.The church,which is built on shale,is mostly made of granite.After 20 _30 years the church will have no more room for burials so they will be forced to use glebeland.Glebeland is fields owned by the church which farmers rent until the graveyard is full and the church claims it back and uses it for graves.The graveyard is about one and a half acres.The church is a 15th century church.The recent extension was built in about 1550.Our local church is called St James.The rector of it is Reverend Hugh Fryer. The biggest stained glass window is 18 square metres.
